column1: 13;"Mat 5:13";"primary";"Discipleship Commands";"HSV";"U bent het zout van de aarde. maar als het zout zijn smaak verloren heeft
column2: waarmee zal het gezouten worden? Het deugt nergens meer voor dan om weggeworpen en door de mensen vertrapt te worden.";"U bent het zout van de aarde";"Be salty and be at peace with each other";;"Salt is an indispensable requirement for the body. Is is both a tasty condiment and a preservative for food. Jesus told his disciples
column3: “You are the salt of the earth” (Mat 5:13). They were to be the life-sustaining element in a dying world that would attract people to the gospel
column4: and they were to be a preservative in a rotting world of sin.

column1: Their salty impact on society would generate “peace with each other”. If the disciples had kept the salt fresh in themselves
column2: they would not have been arguing about who would be the greatest in Christ’s kingdom (Mark 9:34). Each was lusting to be more important that the other (Mark 10:35-45). They were losing their saltiness. Soon the responsibility of world evangelism would be placed in their hands
column3: so peace among them was vital (Col 3:15). To maintain their team spirit and bond of unity
column4: Paul encouraged Christians to “let your conversation be always full of grace
column5: seasoned with salt” (Col 4:6). We are to keep each other submissive to His word.";;"Walking His way - Don Fanning - #210";"Moving Works";"We Are the Salt";"This two minute short reveals the great need to reach people who have no access to the Gospel and how God's Spirit has been moving to reach the unengaged of Mali.";"en";"ShortMovie";"yes";"https://www.youtube.com/embed/FZtJ8OWs2EA";"Has sin corrupted your saltiness?";;;

column1: 22;"Mat 5:44-47";"primary";"Discipleship Commands";"HSV";"Maar Ik zeg u: Heb uw vijanden lief. […]  zodat u kinderen zult zijn van uw Vader
column2: Die in de hemelen is

column6: wat doet u meer dan anderen? Doen ook de tollenaars niet zo?";"Heb uw vijanden lief en bid voor hen die je vervolgen";"Love your enemies and pray for persecutors";"Do not say
column7: I’ll do to them as they have done to me";"This sevenfold description of our obligation to love others shows the characteristics of our geavenly Father. We are expected to reflect the character and attitudes of our God and Savior. Of course
column8: this is possible only by the power of the Spirit as He manifests the presence of God. This is how He is glorified.

column1: Jesus begins by addressing “you who are listening.” They were all hearing
column2: but not all were listening. First
column3: you are to “continually be loving your enemies”. This is not an emotional live or a friendly love. It is agape love: a decision to sacrifice for the benefit of others regardless of your feelings toward them.

column1: Second
column2: you are to “do good to those who hate you”
column3: which amplifies how we are to love our enemies. Good means “excellent
column4: appropriate [or] beneficial.”

column1: Third
column2: God says
column3: “bless those who curse you
column5: which means to “speak well of” anyone who “curses” or speak poorly of you
column6: seeking to damage you.

column1: Fourth
column2: you are to “be continually praying for those who mistreat you”. You must forgive them and pray that God will clarify to them the gospel’s value.

column1: The fifth through seventh commands are not to retaliate (Luke 6:29a)
column2: to give freely (6:29b-30)
column3: and to treat others they way we would want to be treated (6:31). Jesus’s love is unique from the world’s (6:32-33). His followers stand out because they care for everyone.  ";;"Walking His way - Don Fanning - #211";"Harbinger Media Partners";"Unconditional";;"en";"Movie";"yes";"https://www.youtube.com/embed/TsEEUgyPmaI";"Do you really want to be a follower of Jesus?";;;

column2: that I will do
column3: that the Father may be glorified in the Son. If you ask anything in my name
column4: I will do it” (John 14:13).

column1: How much more encouragement do we need to pray for great things that will honor and glorify the Father through the Son? The Father knows how to help us glorify Christ before we ask
column2: but He waits for us to be concerned enough to ask “It shall come to pass that before they call
column3: I will answer. and while they are still speaking
column4: I will hear” (Isa 65:24. By His response
column5: everyone will recognize it was God’s doing.

column1: Don’t be misled into thinking that this promise is all about you. it is all about God. James clarifies how to pray
column2: saying
column3: “You want what you don’t have
column4: so you scheme and kill to get it. You are jealous of what others have
column5: but you can’t get it
column6: so you fight and wage war to take it away from them. Yet you don’t have what you want because you don’t ask God for it. And even when you ask
column7: you don’t get it because your motives are all wrong. You want only what will give you pleasure.” (James 4:2-3)

column1: Stop a moment and think of all the ways you could glorify God through your life and service. He primarily becomes evident to others by answering the prayers of His servants who want Him to be recognized as a powerful and prayer-answering God. column2: want de dag van morgen zal voor zichzelf zorgen. elke dag heeft genoeg aan zijn eigen kwaad.";"Zoek het Koninkrijk van God";"Pursue Christ’s kingdom priority";"Do not worry about your life";"One of the advantages of becoming a Christian is that you now have a purpose in life. Jesus called for a complete reorientation of life’s values
column3: objectives
column4: and purpose.

column1: Everyone needs to put bread on the table
column2: but Jesus demands that His followers “not seek what you should eat or what you should drink
column3: nor have an anxious mind.” (Luke 12:29). He then states
column4: “For all these things the nations of the world seek after” (12:30). Jesus expects us to live with a different motivation and purpose
column5: Neither survival nor comfort is to be our driving impulse.

column1: Luke introduces this command with “instead” to emphasize the opposite focus from the previous verse for the believer. Jesus said
column2: “The Father knows that you need these things” (12:30). To begin with
column3: can we trust Him? Can we rest securely in the awareness that He knows our needs?

column1: If we trust in Him
column2: we are free to focus on His temporal and eternal purposes. He commands us to “be continually or habitually pursuing His kingdom.” The kingdom needs never end.

column1: This was an introduction to the Great Commission: “Go and make disciples of all nations” (Matt 28:19). Christ’s kingdom is extended by multiplying individual converts and leading them to surrender to the lordship of Christ on this earth.
How obedient are you today in this task? What is more important: your job
column2: home or business venture? What if His commitment to meet your needs were proportional to your commitment to Him? God does not promise riches
column3: but He does promise to meet the needs of His servants who are reaching and building disciples in His kingdom.

column1: He must be King of your life as well as your Savior. His will must control your finances
column2: work ethic
column3: ambitions
column4: relationships
column5: thoughts
column6: and daily plans. As Creator
column7: He promises to take care of you if you are useful to His kingdom now.";;"Walking His way - Don Fanning - #138";"Christian Verwoerd";"Hoor jij de vogels nog fluiten";;"nl";"Song";"yes";"https://www.youtube.com/embed/ngZeLwK9y-c";;;;"mussen die brood eten?"

column1: Our command is similar to saying
column2: “Love your neighbor”. The present-tense imperative means “to be continuously producing
column3: [or] causing something to happen”
column4: especially for the benefit of another person in this context. The Golden Rule has no restrictions
column5: because love is not dependent on the response of the other person.

column5: understand and obey";;"Jesus was not just teaching a subject matter. He was communicating truths about life and eternity. His information was urgent

column1: The first command is to “continually listen to me.”. This means not just hearing but also giving “special attention to hear with the ear of the mind” (Zodhiates. #191). The elements of the truth must be clear before the dots can be connected.
The second command is to “understand” what He was saying. It means to “put it together
column2: comprehend
column3: assembling individual facts into an organized whole.”

column1: The third command is to “obey”. If you keep doing what you did
column2: you will get what you did. But if you will give hearing to what Jesus is teaching
column3: you will do something new.

column1: The scene Peter
column2: James and John have witnessed is the only audible message from God the Father to us: “This is my one dear Son
column3: in whom I take great delight. Listen to him!”
column4: The purpose was to make sure His disciples took seriously everything He said and later would say through the Spirit’s inspiration to the apostles and prophets.

column1: Everyone becomes to the one to whom he listens! The most repeated command in the book of Revelation is this: “He who has an ear
column2: let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches” (Rev 2:7). Nine times “hear” is a command in the Revelation. The aorist form of these verbs demands an immediate response to what is commanded.";;"Walking His way - Don Fanning - #18
column3: #212";"Jenske Visser";;;;"Drawing";"yes";"/media/images/36_-_Listen_to_Him.png";"What makes it difficult for you to listen
column4: understand and obey?";"When a man listens
column5: God speaks. If a man obeys
column6: God acts. When a man prays
column7: God gives strength.";"Corrie ten Boom";

column2: to sow and harvest";;"Jesus concluded His ministry in Galilee
column3: seeking disciples. Here we are given a glimpse into Jesus’s constant task of recruiting disciples and challenging them to give up their ambitions and follow Him.

column1: Though many (or most?) were focused on their own interests and walked away from Jesus’s challenge to them (Luke 9:57-61)
column2: He told them
column3: “No one
column4: having put his hand to the plow
column5: and looking back is fit for the kingdom of God” (9:61). Half-hearted commitments never last.

column1: Do the unevangelized reserve a change to hear the gospel? “Certainly”
column2: we respond
column3: yet our real answer is betrayers by how little we pray for “workers” to go
column4: by how little we care for people who have never heard
column5: and how little we help those who are going. Be warned: as you pray for workers
column6: you may be asking God to send you!";;"Walking His way - Don Fanning - #191";;;;;;;;;;;

41;"Mat 10:7";"primary";"Witnessing Commands";"NBV";"Ga op weg en verkondig: “Het koninkrijk van de hemel is nabij.”";"Verkondig het evangelie van Jezus Christus onder alle volken";"Proclaim the gospel of Jesus Christ to all nations";;"In a mission conference
column2: the banner across the front of the auditorium stated
column3: “Don’t take the ‘Go’ out of the Gospel.” We naturally find a myriad of excuses for why we cannot go to preach the gospel.

column1: The resurrected Christ reiterated five times His final charge: “Go into to all the world.” Christ’s death on the cross was to be proclaimed around the world. There is no news more dramatic than this: “God made him who had no sin to be sin for us
column2: so that in Him we might become the righteousness of God” (2 Cor 5:21).

column1: God asked the question: “Then I heard the voice of the Lord saying
column2: ‘Whom shall I send? And who will go for us?’ And I said
column3: ‘Here am I. Send me!’ He said
column4: ‘Go and tell this people’.” (Isa 6:8-9). Was this written merely so we could appreciate Isaiah’s courage
column5: or was it a glimpse into the perpetual heavenly issue? God is asking
column6: “Who cares about our agenda for telling the world about Jesus?” ";;;"Casting Crowns";"Nobody";;"en";"Song";"yes";"https://www.youtube.com/embed/1yBzIt_z8oY";"Who cares about our agenda for telling the world about Jesus?";;;

column3: he lasts only a short time. When trouble or persecution comes because of the Word
column4: he quickly falls away” (Matt 13:21). column2: Jesus challenges his followers
column3: “Take my yoke upon you and learn from Me”. The yoke
column4: with regard to animals
column5: means control and submission to your owner
column6: but with humans
column7: the imagery signifies slavery to Jesus and His will.

column2: a student is under the yoke of his teacher
column3: which means he submits to his teachings. This first phrase is then parallel to the second phrase: “and learn from Me”. The word learn means to become a “disciple or learner”.

column2: we too become trustworthy

column4: importance

column6: or popularity of a leader that attracts others to blindly follow him? Or is it due to the selfless

zal de Zoon des mensen komen.";"Wees waakzaam om de komst van Jezus";"Be ready for the coming of Jesus";;"

In Luke 12:35-40
column4: Jesus begins to gird up your loins and have the lamp burning. He then called on to be vigilant and ready for the arrival of the Son of Man.

column1: We hardly know the word loin today. A loincloth is a piece of clothing that consists only of a cotton cloth that is worn around the loins - the hips. The loins are the center of your body. The Hebrew expression ""the loins girded"" has more to do with a tunic
column2: an undergarment. If something had to be done quickly
column3: the tunic was tied around the loins with a leather belt. It was a starting position of someone who had to take action. In the East
column4: both men and women wore long clothes that reached the feet. The rug was held up with the belt
column5: so that the feet and legs had more freedom of movement. When girdling the loins
column6: the long overcoat was taken up and put into the belt
column7: or pulled up by the belt
column8: when preparing to do work or travel.

column1: Someone who pulls up his long clothing and ties it around his loins with a belt
column2: so he can move quickly. The Israelites had to be ready in the night of their departure from Egypt
column3: the loins girded in order to be able to leave immediately. (Exodus 12:11). Elijah girded his loins to rush out for Ahab (1 Kings 18:46). We must also be ready to expect the arrival of the Son of Man at all times.

column1:
""Blessed are those slaves whom the Lord will find waking when he comes."" (Luke 12:37)

";"

In Lukas 12:35-40 begint Jezus om je lendenen te omgorden en de lamp brandend te hebben. Vervolgens roept hij op om waakzaam te zijn en paraat te staan voor de komst van de Mensenzoon.

Het woord lendenen kennen wij vandaag nauwelijks meer. Een lendendoek is een kledingstuk dat slechts bestaat uit een katoenen lap die om de lendenen - de heupen- wordt gedragen. De lendenen zijn het midden van je lichaam. De Hebreeuwse uitdrukking ‘ de lendenen omgord’ heeft meer te maken met een tunica
column2: een onderkleed. Als men vlug iets moest doen dan werd die tunica met een leren gordel opgebonden rond de lendenen. Het was een starthouding van iemand die in actie moest komen. In het Oosten droegen zowel mannen als vrouwen lange kleren
column3: die tot de voeten reikten. Met de gordel werd het kleed opgehouden
column4: zodat de voeten en benen meer bewegingsvrijheid hadden. Bij het omgorden van de lendenen werd het lange overkleed opgenomen en in de gordel gestoken
column5: of door de gordel omhoog getrokken
column6: als men zich voorbereidde om werk te verrichten of te reizen.

column1: Iemand die zijn lange kleding omhoog trekt en het met een gordel om zijn lendenen vastbindt
column2: die kan zich dus snel verplaatsen. De Israëlieten moesten in de nacht van hun vertrek uit Egypte zo klaar staan
column3: de lendenen omgord
column4: om direct te kunnen vertrekken. (Exodus 12:11). Elia omgordde zijn lendenen om zo voor Achab uit te snellen (l Koningen 18:46). Zo moeten wij ook klaarstaan om de komst van de Mensenzoon ten alle tijden te verwachten.

column1:
“Zalig zijn die slaven die de heer bij zijn komst wakend zal vinden.” (Luk 12:37)

column1: 30. En werp de onnutte dienaar uit in de buitenste duisternis. daar zal gejammer zijn en tandengeknars.";"Gebruik je talenten tot eer van de Vader";"Use your talents to honor the Father";;"There is no question that we are all unworthy of praise
column2: but the word “undeserving” (Luke 17:10) means to be “useless
column3: of no use or profit
column4: or worthless.” Such a person is like the steward who received a talent of silver from his master
column5: but was afraid to do anything with it and simply returned it to his master. There is no indication in the text that any oh the three stewards were told what to do with the wealth they had been given. The one who produced nothing more than what he was given was “useless” because he was unproductive.

column1: Employers become frustrated when they must tell their employees what to do every day
column2: The better employee knows what needs to be done and uses his ingenuity
column3: creativity
column4: and skills to make the employer successful and accomplish his mission. Every employer dreams about this kind of employee.

column1: The classic illustration if this principle is the Great Commission. Jesus told the Twelve and other listeners to make sure the gospel is preached to every tongue
column2: tribe
column3: people
column4: and ethnic people group on earth (Matt 24:14. 28:19-20). He never said how it should be done or who should do it. He expects the profitable servant to figure it out so that He may reward the servant for his creative service.

column1: The judgment seat of Christ is all about discerning who is “good” (profitable
column2: useful) and who is “bad” (worthless
column3: cowardly) for the kingdom’s sake (2 Cor 5:10). It is not about who has been good or bad morally but about who has contributed to expanding the kingdom around the globe without having to be told how – just because they know it is their Savior’s desire. All the rewards of heaven are promised to this kind of obedient believer.";;"Walking His way - Don Fanning - #356";"Casting Crowns";"Thrive";;"en";"Song";"yes";"https://www.youtube.com/embed/qQ71RWJhS_M";"What talents do you use to glorify the Father?";;;

column1: 71;"Mar 11:12-23";"primary";"Witnessing Commands";"HSV";;"Heb vertrouwen in God";"Have faith in God";;"Teaching moments are spontaneous opportunities to illustrate an important principle or truth. During a Jewish holiday
column2: Jesus and Hid disciples had been walking back and forth from Bethany to Jerusalem. The previous morning
column3: they walked past a fig tree that was barren of fruit. Strangely
column4: He declared
column5: “let no one eat fruit from you ever again”. He was setting up a future teaching moment.

column1: The next morning
column2: walking back into Jerusalem
column3: they passed this same fig tree
column4: only now “the fig tree dried up from the roots”. Shocked
column5: Peter exclaimed
column6: “Rabbi
column7: look! The fig tree which You cursed was withered away”
column8: to which Jesus replied
column9: “Have faith in God”.

column1: The disciples were to have an unwavering trust in the omnipotent God who can do anything that He wills to do for His own purposes. The key to an unconditional faith is to have a “no-matter-what” trust and an “anything-is-possible” kind of confidence in the God who cares. through He may seem silent at time
column2: He is always present and can change things any time He wants.

column1: If you fully give you life over to God (Rom 12:1-2)
column2: then whatever God allows to happen in your life is OK. It belongs to Him. He can do with it whatever He wants
column3: even if that means tragedies or miraculous interventions. Either one is OK
column4: since now your life belongs to Jesus. He makes no mistakes.

column1: The one who learns to trust God fully knows He can be trusted with however He may decide to answer to his prayers. Jesus continues in the next verse
column2: “For assuredly
column3: I say to you
column4: whoever says to this mountain
column5: ‘Be removed and be cast into the sea
column6: ’ and does not doubt in his heart
column7: but believes that those things he says will be done
column8: he will have whatever he says.” \n

column1: Jesus
column2: by using hyperbole
column3: illustrated the virtually limitless possibilities for the believer with faith who “does not doubt in his heart”.

column1: Earlier Jesus had said
column2: “With men it is impossible
column3: but not with God. for with God all things are possible” (Mark 10:27). As committed as you are to His word and purpose in life
column4: you can count on His power to assist you to accomplish His will and purpose for your life. “Have faith…”";;"Walking His way - Don Fanning - #31";;"Trust God first";;"en";"Sermon";"yes";"https://www.youtube.com/embed/FrNamnkxzkA";;"Fear is the glue that keeps you stuck. Faith is the solvent that sets you free.";"Shannon L. Alder";

column1: 73;"Mar 13:11";"primary";"Persecution Commands";"HSV";;"Vertrouw erop dat de Heilige Geest je zal leiden";"Trust that the Spirit will guide you";"Do not worry about what to say";"Jesus gave His disciples instructions for how to respond to inevitable persecution. They were commanded to “stop worrying” (implying that they were worrying) and to “continuously say” what the Spirit brought to their minds at the time (John 14:26). What we have learned of His word will come back to our minds when we need it: “Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John
column2: … they marveled. And they realized that they had been with Jesus” (Acts 4:13).";;"Walking His way - Don Fanning - #290";;;;;;;;"Imagine yourself on trial for your faith";"Pray
column3: and let God worry.";"Martin Luther";

74;"Mar 14:38";"primary";"Prayer Commands";"HSV";;"Wees alert en bid dat je niet in verzoeking komt";"Stay alert and pray not to fall into temptation";;"One of the many attributes of Jesus was His ability to be ready for whatever happened. What seemed to hurt Him most was the selfishness or disinterest of His closest friends when He knew they would e tempted and fail Him.
To the very end
column2: Jesus was committed to training His disciples. He was telling them the secret of inner fortitude. Three times Jesus interrupted His prayers to check on His disciples who had lost interest and falles asleep. Each time
column3: Jesus exhorted all three to “Stay awake”
column4: or to stay alert for spiritual dangers
column5: deceptions
column6: or disillusionments. They were to “pray”
column7: which expresses total dependence on the power and presence of God.

column1: The “spirit”
column2: which is willing
column3: must be strengthened through prayer to overcome the weakness of the self-interest of the flesh. ";;"Walking His way - Don Fanning - #189";;;;;;;;"Have you experienced the presence of Christ in areas of testing?";;;

75;"Luk 1:50";"primary";"Witnessing Commands";"HSV";"Zijn barmhartigheid is van geslacht tot geslacht over hen die Hem vrezen.";"Heb ontzag voor Hem";"Fear Him";;"Jesus commanded his disciples to be fearless even when threatened with physical death for proclaiming the good news. At worst
column2: the opposition can only bring about physical death
column3: which is meaningless in comparison to Him would likely result in a death sentence from the state
column4: but is was not to be feared
column5: is was to be welcomed!

column1: God commands us to fear Him. Whomever you fear
column2: you will obey. When people fear the authorities are watching or will find about their actions
column3: they tend to obey to the laws.

column1: Likewise
column2: Christians can become presumptuous because of God’s patience
column3: deceiving themselves into believing that God will do nothing. They think He is too loving and forgiving to punish them. Satan deceived Eve into believing that God would do nothing if she disobeyed. When she believed the lie
column4: she became vulnerable to disobedience.

column1: Proverbs 1:7 says: “The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge
column2: but fools despise wisdom and discipline.” The first lesson a believer should learn – the beginning of wisdom – is that it is a painful experience to disobey the Lord. The author of Hebrews wrote “My son
column3: do not despise the chastening of the Lord. Nor be discouraged when you are rebuked by Him. For whom the Lord lives He chastens. And scourges every son whom He receive. But if you are without chastening
column4: of which all have become partakers
column5: then you are illegitimate and not sons” (Heb 12:5-6). Christians are forgiven their sins
column6: but God will teach us not to be disobedient by certain chastisement.

column1: If we do not fear God’s promise of chastisement
column2: then we tend to be morally loose. If we fear that He will do what He says in His word
column3: then we begin to take His commands seriously. This is a healthy motivation to learn what God expects of us as His children – this is where wisdom begins.";;"Walking His way - Don Fanning - #28";"Christian Verwoerd";"Vol ontzag";;"nl";"Song";"yes";"https://www.youtube.com/embed/Av18VFpPTao";;;;

column2: al heeft iemand overvloed
column3: zijn leven behoort niet tot zijn bezit.";"Wees tevreden met wat je hebt";"Be content with what you have";"Be wary of greed";"Greed enters our lives camouflaged as innocent ambition to be the best
column4: but the masquerade hides the desie to be better
column5: wealthier
column6: or famous – and to own more or better things – than anyone in our circle of friends. This quest for acceptance
column7: respect
column8: or honor is motivated by the belief that this is the way to find fulfillment and satisfaction in life. Greed usurps the place of God in our lives
column9: yet is a poor substitute
column10: however enticing.

column1: When Jesus asked about a man’s inheritance
column2: He knew the man was preoccupied with getting his hands on the wealth that he thought he needed and was due to him. Jesus took the occasion to explain the vice that turns our hearts against the will and purpose of God. He gives two commands asking us to be alert against being deceived or blind sided. We are told to “continually be taking heed
column3: ” “perceiving with the mind
column4: ” and to “continually be keeping ourselves on guard
column5: ” or “be aware of” traps or vices of “greed” or covetousness – that is
column6: the “constant desire or thirst to have more and more.”

column1: How do you know if greed has taken root in your heart? The first symptom is discontent with whatever you have and the willingness to sacrifice everything or anyone to acquire more. As soon as one item is acquired
column2: you are already thinking of something else you need.

column1: The second symptom is the anger felt when someone or something impedes tour acquisition of what you believe is necessary for your happiness. When you believe you need a sizable bank account valance to feel secure about your future
column2: then whenever a preacher mentions tithing or generosity
column3: your emotions will flare up. Anger is a reaction to something or someone that interferes with what you think you need for security or success. Do you resent being asked for your help?";;"Walking His way - Don Fanning - #137";;;;;;;;"Do you recognize one of the symptoms for greed mentioned in the description?";"Often people ask how I manage to be happy despite having no arms and no legs. The quick answer is that I have a choice. I can be angry about not having limbs
column4: or I can be thankful that I have a purpose. I chose gratitude.";"Nick Vujicic";"cactus girl"

80;"Luk 16:29";"primary";"Judgment Seat Commands";"HSV";;"Luister naar Gods Woord";"Listen to God’s Word";;"In the story of the rich man and Lazarus
column2: the rich man is suffering the pains of hell while pleading with Abraham to send someone to tell his five brothers about the reality of hell. He was convinced that if his brothers talked to someone sent back from the dead
column3: they would believe.

column1: But Abraham responded
column2: “They have the Old Testament prophets
column3: obey them” This is the message of Abraham through Christ’s message to the world. If you want to know the reality of eternity
column4: then learn well the revealed word of God and obey what you find there. If the rich man’s brothers would not respond to the major message of God is His word
column5: then they would not listen to a messenger  even if he came from the grave.

column1: God is amazingly gracious with His creatures
column2: but they have to choose. If they choose to live life without God
column3: paying no attention to His word
column4: then God will let them do so in this life and then forever live without Him forever.

column1: God’s primary means of communicating His will and hope for mankind is through His written word. It seems men want any other means to hear from God except a revealed written word. Jesus came to declare God’s will and then inspired His chosen disciples to record His will for all time. Now the only way we will ever know His will is to search it out in His written word.
Second
column2: He reveals the principle that it is not miraculous messengers or signs that will convert a soul. The brothers would be shocked or awestruck by the appearance of such resurrected souls with a message directly from hell
column3: but this would have no life-changing power. They might be so awestruck that they would superficially worship God even more
column4: but they would ultimately fail to yield to His commands.

column1: A follower must believe from the heart – that is
column2: he must wants Jesus to be constant companion and His authority in this life. Miracles are only effective in convincing people that God is real
column3: but they do not make a person want Jesus as a permanent part his life.

column1: Abraham in essence told the rich man
column2: “No! This is not how God works with men.” The only way to know the truth that will free the sinner from his sins is through the written word of God.";;"Walking His way - Don Fanning - #15";"Moving Works";"El Shaddai Sings";"This is El Shaddai. She is an Ethiopian orphan who is being raised by her adopted Ethiopian parents to love Jesus and to sing about His Word. This is her act of worship.";"en";"ShortMovie";"yes";"https://www.youtube.com/embed/rI2XdMxyBWk";"Once you know what He says
column3: can you trust it?";;;
